newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends flat in a dull market.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends flat in a dull market.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka recovered from early losses and closed flat at 42.5490/5495 to the dollar in a dull interbank session, dealers said.
Dealers said the local currency quoted at 42.5480/5500 against dollar in early trade but later gained slightly as a leading dollar-buying bank stayed off the market.

The interbank call money rates finished unchanged at 4.5 percent to 5.5 percent despite Monday's auction of treasury bills by the central bank. Dealers expect an impact from the auction on Thursday. -- Dhaka Newsroom +880-2-506363
